questions.question: Which building, opened in 1973 and located in the heart of Sydney, is recognized as a modern architectural marvel for its unique sail-like design?

questions.question: Which famous museum in Paris houses the Mona Lisa and was originally built as a fortress in the 12th century?

questions.question: What is the iconic, historic amphitheater located in Rome that was inaugurated in AD 80 and is now one of Italy's most famous ancient ruins?

questions.question: Which important battle site, located in Belgium, was the setting for Napoleon Bonaparte's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: This site marks the end of Napoleon's rule and the start of a new era for Europe.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in Petra, was the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom and is famous for its rock-cut architecture?
questions.context: Often referred to as the 'Rose City' due to the color of the stone, it is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
